name: Bibimbap
description: A popular Korean dish that means 'mixed rice.' It's served as a bowl of warm white rice topped with sautéed and seasoned vegetables, chili pepper paste (gochujang), a fried egg, and sliced meat (usually beef).
steps: Cook the rice according to package instructions.
Prepare and sauté each vegetable separately in a pan with a small amount of oil.
Marinate beef slices in soy sauce, garlic, and sesame oil, then fry until cooked.
Fry an egg, keeping the yolk runny.
Assemble the dish by placing rice in a bowl, arranging the vegetables and beef on top, and placing the fried egg in the center.
Serve with a dollop of gochujang on the side.
tips: Sauté vegetables with minimal seasoning to maintain their natural flavors.
Serve hot with additional sesame seeds and seaweed flakes for garnish.
Mix all ingredients in the bowl before eating for the best experience.
